info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 14 at 2:55AM PST until January 15 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 4 AM PST SUNDAY ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Moderate snow expected above 4000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 15 inches with locally higher amounts up to 20 inches above 5000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph over exposed higher terrain. * WHERE...Mountains in western Siskiyou County above 4000 feet, mainly west of the Scott Valley. This includes higher portions of Grayback Road north of Happy Camp and higher portions of Sawyers Bar Road. * WHEN...From noon today to 4 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Very low visibilities may occur, especially as snowfall rates peak Saturday evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels are expected to lower from 4500 to 4000 feet during the afternoon, then will remain near 4000 feet tonight. Snowfall rates may reach 1 inch per hour at times today into tonight. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
